capsules_submitted.utterance: I think McGonagall's glasses are really cool. I mean, who wouldn't want to wear a pair of magical square-lenses that can see through all sorts of spells and potions? It's just so... fitting for her character as the Transfiguration professor.

I think McGonagall's glasses are really cool, I mean, who wouldn't want to be able to see through solid objects? But at the same time, they do make her look a bit... stern. I'd say my certainty about this is pretty high, it's just something that's always been true in the Harry Potter books.

I think McGonagall's glasses are really cool, I mean, who wouldn't want to be able to see through solid objects? But at the same time, they do make her look a bit... stern. I'd say my certainty on this is pretty high, it's not like I've ever seen anyone else with square-lenses before. The polarity is mostly positive, I feel like they add to her character as a witch and a teacher. As for sentiment, I'd say it's more of admiration than anything else.

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been a huge fan of Professor McGonagall. She's an amazing witch and an incredible role model for young witches everywhere. I mean, who wouldn't want to be just as brave and wise as she is? The way she can transform into a cat at will is just incredible! And let's not forget about her sharp wit and quick thinking - she's always got everyone's back in times of need. I'm so glad we had the chance to learn from her at Hogwarts, that's for sure.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Petunia is a lovely name, and I just love that it's associated with such a beautiful flower. You know, I've always been fascinated by the way certain names can evoke emotions and memories. Anyway, Petunia being a female name makes me think of all the sweet and delicate things in life.
